There were no significant correlations between environmental beliefs and arousal scores, r(60) = 0.001, p = 0.994, or valence scores, r(60) = −0.174, p = 0.175, for the most relevant images. Nor were there significant correlations between environmental beliefs and arousal scores, r(60) = −0.041, p = 0.751, or valence scores, r(60) = 0.005, p = 0.969, of the least relevant images. This suggests that participants’ ecological views may not have been related to their opinions on the emotional qualities of the images
2 , only their opinions on the images’ relevance to climate change.
